title: [Large-Scale] Embodied-Based Optical Experiment Simulation Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic optical concepts (properties of light, reflection/refraction, etc.)
context.additional_context: A program for pre-service/in-service teachers to strengthen optical experiment simulation competencies through smartphone-based embodied learning

learning_goals: Learners can perform optical experiment simulations on smartphones with ≥80% accuracy using embodied interactions (e.g., finger gestures)
Learners can generate ≥3 conceptual models explaining light path changes by connecting physical movements and environmental factors during experiments
Learners can design instructional plans applying embodied learning to students as prospective teachers based on simulation results

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
